com.percussion.services.security
Interface IPSAclService

public interface IPSAclService

This interface consists of methods to help managing object ACLs. ACL objects need the Principal who is accessing or modifying it which is part of some user context information. This class takes the user context information in the ctor and helps simplifying operations involving the object ACL, user context information and may be some other business rules.

All the loadAclXXX methods return read-only objects. These are cached and may be shared among threads; the caller should never modify them. If changes need to be made, either the loadAclsModifiable(List) or loadAclsForObjectsModifiable(List) method should be used.

Version:
6.0
Author:
Ram

Method Detail

getUserAccessLevel

PSUserAccessLevel getUserAccessLevel(IPSGuid objectGuid)
A convenience method that retrieves the acl for the object with the supplied id and calls calculateUserAccessLevel(IPSAcl).

Parameters:
objectGuid - The guid of the object for which the current user's effective access level needs to be computed. Must not be null

calculateUserAccessLevel

PSUserAccessLevel calculateUserAccessLevel(IPSAcl acl)
Computes the current user's effective access level to the object protected by the supplied ACL. The effective access level of a user is the highest permission he or she can get on the associated object based on all entries in the ACL.

Parameters:
acl - The acl which will be used to compute the access. If null, all access is allowed. Must be an ACL previously returned by this interface.
Returns:
the effective access level for the current user via the supplied ACL, never null.

createAcl

IPSAcl createAcl(IPSGuid objGuid,
                 IPSTypedPrincipal owner)
Create an acl for the specified object.

Parameters:
objGuid - The guid of the object for which the acl will specify permissions, may not be null.
owner - The owner of the acl, may not be null.
Returns:
The acl, never null. This object will not have been persisted.

loadAcls

List<IPSAcl> loadAcls(List<IPSGuid> aclGuids)
                      throws PSSecurityException
Load ACLs for given list of ACL GUIDs. These objects are cached and shared between threads and should be treated read-only. See the class description for more details.

Parameters:
aclGuids - list of ACL IPSGuid objects to load the ACLs for. Must not be null empty.
Returns:
list of IPSAcl objects, may be null never empty.
Throws:
PSSecurityException - If any of the specified acls cannot be loaded.

loadAclsModifiable

List<IPSAcl> loadAclsModifiable(List<IPSGuid> aclGuids)
                                throws PSSecurityException
Just like loadAcls(List), except the object is always retrieved from the persistent storage, never from cache. See that method for parameter and return description.

Throws:
PSSecurityException

loadAcl

IPSAcl loadAcl(IPSGuid aclGuid)
               throws PSSecurityException
Load the ACL for the specified guid. These objects are cached and shared between threads and should be treated read-only. See the class description for more details.

Parameters:
aclGuid - The guid of the acl to load, may not be null.
Returns:
The acl, never null.
Throws:
PSSecurityException - If the load fails.

loadAclsForObjects

List<IPSAcl> loadAclsForObjects(List<IPSGuid> objectGuids)
Load ACLs for given list of Object guids. These objects are cached and shared between threads and should be treated read-only. See the class description for more details.

Parameters:
objectGuids - list of object IPSGuids to load the ACLs for. Must not be null and no entry should be null.
Returns:
One ACL for each corresponding object id. Some of the entries may be null if the object does not have an ACL. The results are in the same order as the supplied ids.

findObjectsVisibleToCommunities

Collection<IPSGuid> findObjectsVisibleToCommunities(List<String> communityNames,
                                                    PSTypeEnum objectType)
Find all design object GUIDs visible in any of the supplied communities.

Parameters:
communityNames - a list of community names for which to lookup all allowed objects. If null or empty, returns an empty list. Names are case-insensitive.
Returns:
A set of GUIDs that are visible in at least one of the communities in the supplied list and has the supplied type, never null, may be empty.

loadAclsForObjectsModifiable

List<IPSAcl> loadAclsForObjectsModifiable(List<IPSGuid> objectGuids)
Just like loadAclsForObjects(List), except the object is always retrieved from the persistent storage, never from cache. See that method for parameter and return description.

loadAclForObject

IPSAcl loadAclForObject(IPSGuid objectGuid)
Load the ACL for the specified Object guids. These objects are cached and shared between threads and should be treated read-only. See the class description for more details.

Parameters:
objectGuid - the object IPSGuid to load the ACL for. Must not be null.
Returns:
The specified acl, may be null.

loadAclForObjectModifiable

IPSAcl loadAclForObjectModifiable(IPSGuid objectGuid)
Just like loadAclForObject(IPSGuid), except the object is always retrieved from the persistent storage, never from cache. See that method for parameter and return description.

saveAcls

void saveAcls(List<IPSAcl> aclList)
              throws PSSecurityException
Save the supplied ACLs to the system. The objects to be saved may be created outside the service. No ids need to be allocated for the acl entries as these will be allocated by the service. If modifying an existing ACL, then it must have been loaded using either loadAclsModifiable(List) or loadAclsForObjectsModifiable(List).

Parameters:
aclList - List of ACLs to save. Must not be null. Each entry must not have been loaded with any of the loadAclXXX methods.
Throws:
PSSecurityException - If the save fails.

deleteAcl

void deleteAcl(IPSGuid aclGuid)
               throws PSSecurityException
Delete the specified acl from the system.

Parameters:
aclGuid - The acl guid, may not be null. If the specified acl does not exist the method simply returns without error.
Throws:
PSSecurityException - If any delete fails.
